sub_title: Project Coordinator at Raad voor Accreditatie (Dutch Accreditation Council)
summary:
One of my big passions, for over 20 years now, has been (Roman) languages and cultures. I have a bachelor's degree in ITALIAN, one in SPANISH and SPANISH AMERICAN language and culture and a master's degree in WESTERN LITERATURE and CULTURE. I worked and studied for long periods of time in ARGENTINA, ITALY and SPAIN. In the period 2012-2014 I completed two courses of PORTUGUESE at a language institute and in september 2015 I followed an intensive two weeks course in Lisbon.

My experience of TEACHING foreign languages taught me about presentation and education. During my internship in Argentina and years of VOLUNTEER WORK for Erasmus Student Network I learned about organising and (intercultural) communication and my internship at a PUBLISHING house and work as a freelancer for one are good first experiences in the book industry. They also improved my ENGLISH and DUTCH, the latter also by teaching Dutch at a Roman university.

At my first job as a PROJECT MANAGER at a translation and interpretation company, I learned to work under a large amount of stress and in a (time) EFFICIENT way. 1,5 years later I started working at a wholesaler of consumer electronics where I SUPPORTED the subsidiaries and clients in the south of Europe. Here I found out my strenght lies in my PRECISE way of working and SERVICE ORIENTATED, PROBLEM SOLVING and PROACTIVE attitude. During these first three years of my carreer I loved being an INTERMEDIARY. Being the key figure between clients, colleagues and third parties. Furthermore, I discovered that I don't have a commercial nature, I can only be a sales talent when the enthousiasm of a product or service comes from my heart.

Last year I have been a 'buddy' for The Salvation Army, a special and enriching experience. Because I want to put my aversion towards intensive animal farming into actions , I recently applied as a volunteer at 'Varkens in Nood' ('Pigs in distress') who fight for better living conditions in the meat industry.

education.field_of_study: Hispanic and Latin American Languages, Literatures, and Linguistics, General

profile_positions.description: The Dutch Accreditation Council (RvA) is the national accreditation body of the Netherlands. The RvA has the task of accrediting conformity-assessment bodies: laboratories, inspection bodies, certification bodies and verification bodies. Organizations that offers products and / or services that may pose a risk in terms of safety, health and environment and therefore, need or want to be accredited. In other words, "to be regarded as trustworthy". A Project Assistant (PA), forms a team with his or her Accreditation Process Manager (PMA). Where the PMA is overall responsible for the whole process and involved in terms of content of the investigations, the PA is the organizational, communicational and administrative key figure between PMA, institutions, research teams and internal departments such as Finance and IT. The PA plans the investigations and is responsible for the document flow and the time monitoring. Afterwards the PA books the hours, prepares the draft bills, the paper work for the decision making and the accreditation documents.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant

profile_positions.description: This subsidiary of the American company Johnson Health Tech sells fitness and cardio equipment to gyms, government institutions and hotels in the Benelux and beyond. The Inside Sales department is responsible "from order to cash", being a central point of contact for account managers, customers, the Purchase Department and Logistics. I entered orders, made delivery notes and invoices, handled questions and problems from customers and account managers and helped with the Logistics planning.
profile_positions.title: Inside Sales Representative

profile_positions.description:
At this international large wholesaler of consumer electronics and accessories I support the subsidiaries in Italy and Spain (Spanish and Portuguese clients) after their centralization in 2013. I am an intermediary which in close cooperation with other departmens such as Logistics, Transport, ICT, Finance, Purchase and Technical Support is 	helping to solve their problems and informing them about the systems and centralized warehouse. 

At the same time, since January 2015, I am taking care of most of the customer support of NEDIS Italy and Iberia: entering orders, handling the RMA process and answering and solving all kinds of questions and problems customers can experience. (Missing articles or parcels, questions about backorders or invoices, requests of specific products or special product documentation, etc.)

I am also constantly monitoring the processes and systems in order to help among others my manager and the ICT department to improve them.
profile_positions.title: Centralization and Customer Support representative for NEDIS Italy S.R.L. & NEDIS S.L. Iberia

profile_positions.description: As a freelancer for this large publisher of Dutch and international fiction and non-fiction I write reports about foreign manuscripts and books (English, Italian and Spanish).
profile_positions.title: Freelance Proofreader

profile_positions.description:
At this large translation and interpretation company I worked at the department of governmental translations. In a team of six to eight collegues I worked for, among other clients, the Legal Aid Board, several Ministries and the Police. I analysed source files, searched and instructed translators and checked the translations. I also did the client communication, hereby being besides a project manager an account manager too. I also managed on a weekly basis translations and interpreting services for the commercial department like brochures, websites and interpreters for congresses.

This position included a lot of problem solving, like translators who can't make the deadline or complaints from them or the clients. In this job it is important to achieve a certain revenue and margin. To produce this margin negotiation was often necesarry. Besides working with a commercial and a problem solving attitude, being able to cope with stress is key in this work. Other essential skills in this position are operating in a precise way and being adept in friendly and service-oriented communication, towards costumers and translators/interpretors.
profile_positions.title: Project manager

profile_positions.description: The 'Volksuniversiteit ('Popular University') Rotterdam' is a non-profit organization that forms part of a national network of Volksuniversiteiten that offers low coast education to all members of society. I taught Italian lessons here (two groups a week, each group 1,5 hours) at beginners and advanced level, to groups of 3 to 12 students. The focus was on communication in practical (holiday) situations, with the help of a professional study method.
profile_positions.title: Italian Teacher

profile_positions.description: At this literary publishing house in Amsterdam I reviewed Dutch, English, Spanish and Italian manuscripts and books, searched for illustrations for non-fiction books, wrote flyers and back covers and edited manuscripts. Together with my co intern I promoted to the editors a manuscript among the thousands send in every year, the succesful novel 'Vita' by Matthijs Kleyn, which has been printed four times by now.
profile_positions.title: Intern

company.name: Fundación CICLO para la difusión de la cultura latinoamericana.

profile_positions.company: Fundación CICLO para la difusión de la cultura latinoamericana.
profile_positions.description:
This NGO is located in Ramos Mejía, a neighbourhood just outside the city of Buenos Aires. They offer low cost education like language and business courses for people who have difficulties with the standard education forms and need more assistance and a more practical approach. Fundación CICLO also helps them in their surch for jobs. Besides this hey offer free cultural activities such as art workshops, free exhibitons of local artists and discussion nights.

During my six months of internship here I taught courses of English and Italian, worked as a secretary, wrote for the website and searched and tutored new teachers and interns. I also organised together with two other interns from The Netherlands a 'Dutch evening' visited by more then 60 people. Together with a local elementary school, 'Escuela Primaria Alas Argentinas' and in collaboration with the local municipality and the Anne Frank Museum in Buenos Aires we organised for two classes a project about Anne Frank in specific and toleration, equality and respect in general.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

profile_positions.description: This welfare foundation offers low coast courses and activities to the inhabitants of the municipality 'Utrechtse Heuvelrug'. Here I taught courses of Spanish and Italian (one group a week for 1,5 hours) at beginners and advanced level, to groups from 6 to 12 students. The focus was on communication in practical (holiday) situations, with the help of a professional study method.
profile_positions.title: Spanish Teacher

profile_positions.description:
In this large European student organisation I have been a member and in the last year also chairman/secretary of the Activities Committee. With our group of volunteering students I organised a number of cultural and social activities for international students (mostly European students with an Erasmus scholarship). 

Among other things we took them on city trips and weekends away here in The Netherlands, Belgium and Germany and organized cultural and sport events like movie and discussion nights, international dinners, pub crawls, football tournaments and ski, sail and canoeing trips.
profile_positions.title: Member Activities Committee
